text: <@U02E3CRMA> Found this site for wiring the Pi, but I still have no idea what I'm doing :P <http://pi.gadgetoid.com/pinout/spi> Should I be aiming for I2C or SPI? I know that with SPI I can daisy-chain my displays and rely on clock and chip-select (?) pins. Does I2C allow for daisy-chaining?
Here's another page about wiring the SSD1351 controller to an RPi, though the breakout board has slightly different labels than the one we use <http://electronics.ilsoft.co.uk/ColourOLED.aspx>
<@U02F8LF2X> may be interested in this stuff too
That breakout board comes with some code <https://github.com/ilsoftltd/colour-oled/tree/master/raspberryPi>

attachments.title: ilsoftltd/colour-oled
attachments.text: Contribute to colour-oled development by creating an account on GitHub.

attachments.title: achimdoebler/UGUI
attachments.text: UGUI - µGUI - Open Source GUI module for embedded systems

text: his site on that package is <http://www.embeddedlightning.com/ugui/>

attachments.text: μGUI is a free and open source graphic library for embedded systems. It is platform-independent and can be easily ported to almost every micrcontroller system.
attachments.fallback: μGUI is a free and open source graphic library for embedded systems. It is platform-independent and can be easily ported to almost every micrcontroller system.

text: (that page has a download link for a 108page pdf)
I've reached out to the author. <http://www.embeddedlightning.com/ugui/#comment-212>
